The mews was a long, narrow place, with a row of stables on one side and a row of workshops on the other, and it was here that I first caught sight of the figure I had been seeking. He was a tall, thin man with a scruffy beard and a hat pulled low over his eyes, and he was busily engaged in tinkering with a bicycle. I watched him for a few moments, trying to get a better look at his face, and then I decided to make my move. I strolled over to the nearest workshop and began to examine the various tools and equipment on display, all the while keeping a close eye on the mysterious figure. As I did so, I noticed that the man seemed to be working on a rather unusual-looking contraption, and I couldn't help but feel a sense of curiosity about what it might be. I decided to strike up a conversation with him, and after a few minutes of small talk, I managed to get him to reveal to me the purpose of the strange device. It turned out to be some sort of early prototype for a motorcar, and the man was clearly very proud of his creation. I spent the next hour or so chatting with him and learning more about his work, and I must say that I was impressed by his ingenuity and creativity. As the afternoon wore on, I decided it was time for me to be on my way, and I bid the man farewell and continued on my journey. But as I walked away, I couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement and anticipation about the possibilities that this new technology might hold. The implications were vast and far-reaching, and I couldn't help but wonder what the future might hold for this strange and wondrous device.

I grabbed a nearby bucket and began to splash water on the fire, but it seemed to have little effect. The flames were too strong, and they were spreading fast. I looked around frantically for something, anything, that could help us put out the fire. That's when I saw it - a large fire extinguisher hanging on the wall. I grabbed it and turned it on the flames, but just as I was about to spray it, I heard a loud crash from the other side of the room. I turned to see what it was, and that's when I saw her - a woman, dressed in a long, flowing gown, standing in the doorway, her eyes fixed on something behind me. I turned to see what she was looking at, and that's when I saw it - a figure, tall and imposing, standing in the shadows, its eyes fixed on us with an unblinking stare. I felt a shiver run down my spine as I realized that this was no ordinary fire.

La palabra no había salido de mi boca cuando toda la multitud de espectadores, tanto los bien vestidos como los mal vestidos, caballeros, posaderos y sirvientas, se unieron en un grito general de "¡Fuego!". Deslizándome entre la multitud que gritaba, me dirigí a la esquina de la calle, y en diez minutos me alegré de encontrar el brazo de mi amigo entre los míos, y de alejarme de la escena del alboroto. Với sự đồng lõa và hỗ trợ của người vợ, ông ta tự cải trang, che giấu đôi mắt sắc bằng cặp kính râm, hóa trang khuôn mặt bằng một bộ ria và râu quai nón rậm rạp, hạ thấp giọng nói rõ ràng thành tiếng thì thào, cộng thêm một lợi thế an toàn là cô gái bị cận thị, ông ta đã xuất hiện dưới lốt chàng trai Hosmer Angel và gạt những chàng trai khác ra xa bằng cách tỏ tình với cô gái.”

La hija era de buena disposición, afable, pero cariñosa y afectuosa a su manera, de modo que era evidente que con sus buenas ventajas personales y sus escasos ingresos, no se le permitiría permanecer soltera por mucho tiempo. Ahora bien, su matrimonio significaría, por supuesto, la pérdida de cien dólares al año, así que ¿qué hace su padrastro para evitarlo? Toma la medida obvia de mantenerla en casa y prohibirle

It was as if he had simply stumbled and fallen into the pool, but the fact that he was found face down and unconscious suggested that something more sinister might have occurred. The local doctor was called, and he pronounced the man dead, with no signs of any external injury or trauma. The cause of death was listed as drowning, but we couldn't shake the feeling that there was more to the story than met the eye. We decided to investigate further, and began by questioning the other residents of the house, but they all seemed shaken by the event and were reluctant to talk about it. The atmosphere in the house was tense, and it was clear that something was being kept hidden. We pressed on, determined to uncover the truth, and started by searching the garden and the surrounding area for any clues that might lead us to the truth. As we searched, we noticed that the pool was surrounded by a small wooden fence, and the gate was slightly ajar. It was as if someone had recently passed through it, but there was no sign of any footprints or other evidence of recent activity. We made a mental note to investigate the fence and the gate further, and continued our search of the garden. As we moved further away from the pool, we noticed that the grass was trampled and the flowers were disturbed, suggesting that someone had recently walked through this area. We followed the path of the trampled grass, and it led us to a small shed in the corner of the garden. The shed was old and dilapidated, and it looked like it hadn't been used in years. We cautiously approached the shed, and found that the door was slightly ajar. We pushed it open slowly, and found ourselves in a small, dimly lit room. The air was musty and stale, and there was a strong smell of decay. We fumbled for our flashlights and turned them on, and were met with a sight that made our blood run cold. Inside the shed, we found a series of old photographs, and they appeared to be of the deceased man. But what caught our attention was the look in his eyes, a look of pure terror and desperation. It was clear that he had been in a state of great distress, and it seemed that he had been trying to convey a message. We carefully examined the photographs, and found a small note attached to the back of one of them. It was a cryptic message, but it seemed to point to a larger conspiracy. We knew that we had stumbled upon something big, and we were determined to uncover the truth. We carefully collected the photographs and the note, and made our way back to the house to analyze them further. As we walked, we couldn't shake the feeling that we were being watched, and that we were getting close to something that someone was desperate to keep hidden. We quickened our pace, and made our way back to the house, eager to uncover the truth behind the mysterious death.

Sin embargo, nadie había imaginado que esto podría pasar. El detective Holmes escuchó atentamente al médico y luego se volvió hacia Watson y le dijo: "Este caso es más complicado de lo que parece. Hay algo que no cuadra en esta historia". Watson se acercó a él y le preguntó qué quería decir, pero Holmes se limitó a sacudir la cabeza y seguir examinando el cuerpo. Mientras tanto, el médico se alejó, murmurando algo sobre la necesidad de llamar a un forense para realizar la autopsia. El jardín seguía en silencio, pero el detective Holmes parecía estar pensando en algo, algo que lo hacía mover la cabeza y fruncir el ceño. La noche estaba cayendo y el estanque reflejaba la luna llena, creando un efecto de ensueño en la escena. Pero Holmes no parecía estar en un estado de ensueño, sino más bien en un estado de concentración, como si estuviera resolviendo un rompecabezas complejo. Y en ese momento, algo en su rostro cambió, algo que hizo que Watson se detuviera y lo mirara con interés. "¿Qué es, Holmes?", preguntó, pero el detective no respondió, demasiado absorto en sus pensamientos. La noche seguía cayendo y el jardín seguía en silencio, pero el detective Holmes parecía estar en un mundo propio, un mundo de deducciones y teorías, donde la verdad estaba a punto de revelarse. Y en ese momento, Watson se dio cuenta de que este caso no era solo un simple asunto de un joven que se había ahogado en un estanque, sino algo mucho más profundo, algo que involucraba a la familia, a la sociedad y a la propia naturaleza humana.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.
en_results: of a tree or a house, which seemed to flash by in a moment. The trees and fields outside seemed to be passing in a blur, and I felt a bit queasy from the constant motion. I tried to distract myself by thinking about the reason for our journey, but my mind kept wandering back to Colonel Stark's intense gaze. I couldn't help but wonder what he was thinking, and whether he knew something that I didn't. The driver, a gruff but kind-looking man, seemed to be taking us on a circuitous route, and I began to feel a sense of unease. We passed through a small village, and I caught a glimpse of a sign that read "Welcome to Ravenswood" before it disappeared from view. I turned to Colonel Stark, but he was still staring straight ahead, his

The driver, a gruff but kind-looking man, seemed to be taking us on a circuitous route, and I began to feel a sense of unease. We passed through a small village, and I caught a glimpse of a sign that read "Welcome to Ravenswood" before it disappeared from view. I turned to Colonel Stark, but he was still staring straight ahead, his expression unreadable. I felt a shiver run down my spine as we continued on, the trees and fields blurring together in a maddening rhythm. The silence between us grew thicker and more oppressive, and I found myself wondering if we were being led deeper into the woods for some sinister purpose. The driver seemed to sense my unease, and he glanced back at me in the rearview mirror, his expression sympathetic. I tried to smile back at him, but my heart was racing with anticipation. We were getting closer to our destination, but I had no idea what lay ahead.
vi_first_half: “Chúng tôi lên đường và đi được ít nhất một giờ. Đại tá Lysander Stark nói là chỉ có bảy dặm nhưng tôi nghĩ, dựa vào tốc độ xe chạy và thời điểm chúng tôi khởi hành thì quãng đường phải lên đến gần mười hai dặm. Ông ta ngồi bên cạnh tôi và suốt chặng đường chẳng hề mở miệng, cứ mỗi lần liếc nhìn về phía ông ta, tôi lại thấy ông ta đang nhìn tôi với ánh mắt hết sức căng thẳng. Những con đường làng ở đoạn này có vẻ không được tốt lắm vì chúng tôi cứ bị lắc lư và xóc nẩy dữ dội. Tôi cố gắng nhìn ra ngoài cửa sổ để xem mình đang đi đến đâu nhưng kính cửa là loại thủy tinh đã mài mờ nên tôi chẳng phân biệt được gì ngoại trừ một vài vệt sáng lờ mờ thỉnh thoảng băng ngang qua. es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

La música era agradable, pero no parecía ser lo suficientemente atractiva como para romper el silencio que reinaba en el interior del vehículo. El tiempo parecía pasar lentamente, y me di cuenta de que estábamos en un lugar remoto, lejos de la civilización. De repente, el conductor se detuvo en seco, y el vehículo se detuvo en medio de la carretera. El coronel Stark se levantó y miró hacia adelante, y luego se volvió hacia mí con una expresión seria. "¿Qué pasa?", pregunté, pero antes de que pudiera responder, el conductor se levantó y salió del vehículo, y el coronel Stark me dijo: "Vamos a ver".
tr_first_half: "Derken yola çıktıktan sonra en az bir saat boyunca gittik. en_first_half: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath. Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction. It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us. I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand. Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.

en_results_raw: The light danced across her features, illuminating the sharp angles of her cheekbones and the curve of her lips. Her eyes, a deep shade of brown that seemed almost black in the dim light, sparkled with a hint of curiosity as she took in the scene before her. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the woman as if he had just woken up from a dream. The woman's gaze, however, was fixed on me, and I felt a shiver run down my spine as our eyes met. She seemed to be sizing me up, her expression unreadable, and I couldn't help but wonder what she was thinking. The lamp in her hand cast eerie shadows on the walls, making it seem as if the very darkness itself was alive and watching us. The air in the room seemed to thicken, heavy with anticipation, as the woman's eyes never left mine. I felt a sense of unease creeping up my spine, and I couldn't help but wonder what had brought me to this strange and foreboding place. The woman's gaze seemed to hold a secret, a secret that she was reluctant to share, and I found myself wanting to know what it was. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the woman, and I could sense a tension building in the air. The woman's expression remained unreadable, but I could sense a hint of something else, something that seemed to be lurking just beneath the surface. I felt a shiver run down my spine as our eyes remained locked, the only sound in the room the soft creaking of the old wooden floorboards beneath our feet.

es_first_half: "Estaba muy oscuro dentro de la casa, y el coronel buscaba a tientas cerillas y murmuraba en voz baja. De repente se abrió una puerta en el otro extremo del pasillo y una larga barra de luz dorada salió disparada en nuestra dirección. Se ensanchó y apareció una mujer con una lámpara en la mano, que sostenía por encima de la cabeza, adelantando la cara y mirándonos. Pude ver que era guapa, y por el brillo con que la luz iluminaba
es_second_half: su vestido oscuro supe que era de un material rico. Pronunció algunas palabras en una lengua extranjera, en un tono como si estuviera haciendo una pregunta, y cuando mi compañero respondió con un monosílabo ronco, se sobresaltó tanto que la lámpara casi se le cayó de la mano. El coronel Stark se acercó a ella, le susurró algo al oído y luego, empujándola hacia la habitación de la que había salido, volvió a caminar hacia mí con la lámpara en la mano."

es_results_raw: su rostro, me di cuenta de que era una mujer de una belleza que no había visto nunca antes. La luz de la lámpara la hacía brillar como una estrella en una noche oscura, y su cabello oscuro parecía tener un brillo que no era solo producto de la iluminación. El coronel, que había estado murmurando en voz baja, se detuvo en seco y se quedó mirándola con una expresión de sorpresa y admiración. La mujer se acercó a nosotros, y pude ver que llevaba un vestido de seda que brillaba con un brillo dorado, y sus ojos brillaban con una intensidad que me hizo sentir un escalofrío en la espalda. Me di cuenta de que era una mujer que no era solo guapa, sino que también parecía tener un poder que la rodeaba como un aura. El coronel, que había estado tan silencioso hasta ese momento, se acercó a ella y le habló en voz baja, y ella respondió con una sonrisa que me hizo sentir que todo lo que estaba pasando era algo muy especial. Me di cuenta de que la casa estaba llena de secretos y misterios, y que esta mujer era solo el comienzo de una aventura que iba a cambiar mi vida para siempre.

en_first_half: “You will find it rather disconnected, I fear, and there may prove to be little relation between the different incidents of which I speak. On the very first day that I was at the Copper Beeches,
en_second_half: Mr. Rucastle took me to a small outhouse which stands near the kitchen door. As we approached it I heard the sharp rattling of a chain, and the sound as of a large animal moving about.
en_results: there was a most peculiar occurrence which I shall never forget. The housekeeper, Mrs. Grose, had been acting strangely all morning, and I had begun to suspect that she was hiding something
en_results_raw: there was a most peculiar occurrence which I shall never forget. The housekeeper, Mrs. Grose, had been acting strangely all morning, and I had begun to suspect that she was hiding something from me. As I was walking through the garden, I stumbled upon a small, hidden path that I had not noticed before. It was overgrown with weeds and seemed to lead to a part of the garden that was not often visited. I decided to follow it, and as I walked, the trees grew taller and the air grew thick with an eerie silence. Suddenly, I heard a faint noise behind me and turned to see Mrs. Grose standing at the entrance of the path, her eyes fixed intently on me. She seemed to be watching me with an unnerving intensity, and I felt a shiver run down my spine. I tried to brush it off as mere imagination, but the feeling lingered, and I couldn't shake the sense that something was off. As I continued on the path, I began to notice that the trees seemed to be twisted and gnarled, their branches like skeletal fingers reaching out towards me. The air grew colder, and I could see my breath misting in front of me. I quickened my pace, my heart pounding in my chest, and soon found myself at a small clearing. In the center of the clearing stood an old, dilapidated greenhouse, its windows shattered and its door hanging off its hinges. I hesitated for a moment, wondering if I should investigate further, but my curiosity got the better of me, and I pushed open the creaking door and stepped inside. The interior was musty and decaying, the air thick with the scent of rot and decay. I fumbled in my pocket for a match and lit it, casting flickering shadows on the walls. As I looked around, I saw that the greenhouse was filled with all manner of strange and exotic plants, their leaves and stems twisted and gnarled like the trees outside. In the center of the room, I saw a large, ornate box, adorned with strange symbols and markings. It seemed to be emitting a faint hum, and I could feel a strange energy emanating from it. I approached it cautiously, my heart pounding in my chest, and reached out to touch it. As soon as my skin made contact with the box, the hum grew louder, and I felt a surge of electricity run through my body. I stumbled backward, my vision blurring, and when I looked up, I saw Mrs. Grose standing in front of me, her eyes blazing with an otherworldly intensity. She spoke in a low, hypnotic voice, her words dripping with an unsettling sweetness, and I felt myself becoming entranced, my mind clouded by a strange, creeping fog. I tried to resist, but it was too late. The last thing I remember is Mrs. Grose's face, her eyes burning with an unholy light, as the world around me began to spin and fade away.
